results.title: Zardip's search for healthy wellness. Part 1
results.brief_description: This series uses live action, animation and song to promote an awareness and understanding of how the body works and what it needs to stay healthy. In ten episodes, Zardip, a friendly alien, learns about the human body, diet and nutrition, growth, the value of exercise and sleep, germs and how to take care of the teeth.

results.title: Zaa le Petit Chameau
results.brief_description:
Ali has new friend, a white camel called Zaa. But Zaa is kidnapped and taken to the market in Monastia (Algeria) to be sold. Narrated by Francois Perier.

Credits: Director, Jacques Poitrenaud ; writer, Claude Roy ; photography, Andre Dumaitre ; music, Guy Bernard.
Cast: No cast information available.

results.title: Z00 = A Zed and Two Noughts
results.creator_credit: Peter Sainsbury, Artificial Eye and Peter Greenaway
results.brief_description: A bizarre meditation on the processes of life, death and decay, by that stylist of the off-beat and the grotesque, Peter Greenaway. Starring Joss Ackland, Brian Deacon, Eric Deacon, and Andrea Ferreol. “Very funny…very bizarre…beautiful, clever, dazzling.”

results.title: Z is for Zoo
results.creator_credit: Stelios Roccos, ACI Films and Joan Horvath
results.brief_description: Describes activities performed by animals in a zoo to introduce the words: walk, clean, eat, play and tail. Shows elephants, llamas, swans and monkeys.

results.title: Z = 'Z'
results.creator_credit: Jacques Perrin, Valoria Films, Reganne Films and Costa Gavras
results.brief_description: One of the most effective political thrillers ever filmed, “Z” is an account of an opposition MP (Yves Montand) of an unidentified Mediterranean country who is murdered before a national election. Jean-Louis Trintignant plays a magistrate whose investigation leads him to uncovering a secret organisation led by the military who are planning a coup-d’etat. Based on the situation in Greece which led to the military junta of 1966, Greek director Costas Gavras (who was in exile from the Greek Colonels) filmed this tense and exciting thriller in France and Algiers. On its release “Z” became an instant cause-celebre as its combination of melodrama, action and suspense elements made it incredibly effective anti-fascist propaganda. Whereas a film such as “Battle of Algiers” relied on approximation of realism to achieve its political goals, “Z” uses visceral and emotional manipulation to create a rollercoaster ride of a movie which aims to simulate the crisis of a democratic state falling to fascism. The film brought wide attention to the suffering of the Greek people under the junta as well as pointing out the cynical involvement of the CIA in supporting the undemocratic Colonels. With Irene Papas. The thrilling musical score by exiled composer Mikis Theodorakis was taken up by liberation movements throughout the world. Based on the book by Vassilis Vassilikos which was itself a roman-a-clef about the assassination of politician and journalist Lambrakis.

results.title: Yvonne's perfume = Le Parfum d'Yvonne [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Thierry Ganay, Lambart Productions, Zoulou Films, Centre European Cinematographique Rhones-Alpes, M.G. Films and Patrice Leconte
results.brief_description: 1958, a resort hotel on Lake Geneva is the setting for this foray into romance, friendship and decadence. It is at the hotel that Victor meets Dr. Meinthe, a flamboyant homosexual, and Yvonne, a beautiful woman who captures them both. Together, the three of them embark on a summer experience like no other. Cast includes Jean-Pierre Marielle, Hippolyte Girardot and Sandra Majani. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Yves Saint Laurent: Valentino
results.creator_credit: Marlene McGinnis Cardin, Nicolas H Charney and Videofashion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Designers”.
Yves Saint Laurent: Follows the career of renowned French designer Yves Saint Laurent, heralding him as the master of modern couture. The course of fashion was set by Saint Laurent as he became one of the first designers to allow the streets to bear direct influence on his collections. Runway shows from throughout the designer’s career, from his heading of Dior at the age of just 22, to the late ‘90’s, illustrate the longevity of his signature pieces, such as the controversial see-through blouse. Saint Laurent’s long association with French actress Catherine Deneuve is highlighted in interviews and photography. Other interviews include those with the designer himself, and with Jean Loup Sieff and Phillip Miller. “Valentino”: Extensive interviews with the Italian designer Valentino reveal his design philosophy and his beginnings at the age of seventeen. Working for Jean Desse and then Guy Laroche, Valentino quickly established a reputation for himself as a talented designer of women’s fashion. At the time of production the designer’s business was generating $600 million a year in couture and associated lines such as fragrances and accessories. The signatures of the Valentino design are explored, including his all white collections, his prominent use of black and white and the bow. Interviews with a plethora of celebrities including Christy Turlington, Sophia Loren, Sylvester Stallone, Bette Midler and Brooke Shields culminate in a review of the 1991 Park Avenue Armory Valentino exhibition. Valentino is portrayed as a ‘slave to perfection’, and the unchallenged leader of Italian fashion.

results.title: Yuzen kimono
results.brief_description: Shows how the Yuzen-Kimono is made in Kyoto. We follow the process from the designing and making of the wide variety of beautiful hand painted materials, the hand sewing of the traditional kimonos and finally the wearing of them by children and women of all ages on special occasions in the ancient city of Kyoto. Without commentary - music only with English intertitles.

results.title: Yumi yet: Papua New Guinea gets independence
results.creator_credit: Papua New Guinea. Office of Information and Dennis O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Dennis O’Rourke’s brilliant study of Papua New Guinea’s independence celebrations does not belong to the tradition in which an all-knowing, anonymously honeyed voice lulls us with loaded instructions for interpreting a world which it empties of interest. Skilful and humorous editing of the vividly beautiful images and the superb soundtrack of voices, music and radio broadcasts brings out a sense of wonder at a society composed of extraordinary juxtapositions. It is not just that traditional tribal customs co-exist with both the paraphernalia of British and Australian colonialism and the new institutions for independence. Each element actively transforms the others and gives them new meaning. Contains footage of Gough Whitlam, Prince Charles and other dignitaries, as well as the handover ceremonies signifying Papua New Guinea independence. Contains interviews with Papua New Guinea’s first Prime Minister.

results.title: Yum yum noodles
results.creator_credit: David Atkinson, John Bird, Troy Innocent and Elena Popa
results.brief_description: Time for a bowl of something hot, wet and instant - Yum Yum noodles. Buy some today! MSG added for good tasty flavour. A parody of a noodle advertisment that comments on stereotypes of Asian cultures.
